channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AK

item.title: Report X-2025041730
item.description:
Report X-2025041730

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T01:00:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-26
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT NEEDED TO BE REWRAPPED DUE TO GETTING WET FROM RAINWATER. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWO INNER BOXES MARKED NONSPILLABLE RECHARGEABLE SLA BATTERY CONTAINING BELUCE RECHARGEABLE SEALED LEAD-ACID BATTERIES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. NONSPILLABLE BATTERY IS NOT ON THE OUTER BOX.

item.title: Report X-2025041389
item.description:
Report X-2025041389

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-19
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the ANCH a fiberboard box was presented to a spill agent with an odor. While investigating the shipment the spill agent noticed that one of the containers inside was leaking at the closure. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2025040734
item.description:
Report X-2025040734

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-13
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4/12/2025 at approximately 0350, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 4155356 at the ramp facility in Anchorage, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of 7 containers of acrylic paint packaged in a fiberboard box. The shipment emitted a urethane odor, requiring further inspection, searching for a potential leak. While no contents leaked, the inspection did result in the discovery of undeclared paint. The accompanying safety data sheet classified the commodity as nonregulated, which does not appear to be correct. The shipment is being held, pending an investigation by the FAA.

item.title: Report X-2025041386
item.description:
Report X-2025041386

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-05
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A DANGEROUS GOODS AIR PACKAGE THAT WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING IN ANCHORAGE, ALASKA. UPON INSPECTION OF THE INNER CONTENTS THERE WERE 36 BOTTLES OF SPENSER JENSEN BODY HAIR MIST, EACH AT 3.4 OZ CAPACITY. THE HARD PLASTIC BOTTOMS OF TWO OF THE BOTTLES WERE CRACKED LEAKING THEIR ENTIRE CONTENTS. THE PACKAGE ALSO CONTAINED VARIOUS COSMETIC PRODUCTS. THE OUTER PACKAGE WAS PROPERLY MARKED AND LABELED AS DANGEROUS GOODS AND HAD PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY.
